docs.title: Welcome to the Demo Developer Portal
docs.text: This portal provides documentation, tutorials, and references for integrating with our APIs and SDKs.

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• Getting Started – Step-by-step setup for new developers
  • API Reference – Detailed endpoints, parameters, and response examples
  • Tutorials – Hands-on guides with code samples in Python, R, and SQL
  • Release Notes – Track feature changes and bug fixes

All documentation is maintained in GitHub and built using MkDocs (Docs-as-Code workflow).

docs.title: Payments API – Quick Start Guide
docs.text: The Payments API allows you to create and manage transactions securely.

docs.title: 1. Authentication
docs.text:
All requests must include an API key in the Authorization header.

curl -X GET "https://api.example.com/v1/payments"   -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"

Response

{
  "status": "success",
  "payments": []
}

docs.title: POST /v1/payments
docs.text:
Creates a new payment.

Request Example

curl -X POST "https://api.example.com/v1/payments"   -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"   -H "Content-Type: application/json"   -d '{
        "amount": 100,
        "currency": "EUR",
        "recipient": "john.doe@example.com"
      }'

Response Example

{
  "payment_id": "pmt_123456789",
  "status": "pending"
}

docs.title: Tutorial – Build Your First App
docs.text: This tutorial walks you through building a simple app that uses the Payments API.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Install dependencies
pip install requests
  1. Create a new Python file:
import requests

API_KEY = "YOUR_API_KEY"
url = "https://api.example.com/v1/payments"

data = {"amount": 50, "currency": "EUR", "recipient": "jane.doe@example.com"}

response = requests.post(url, headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {API_KEY}"}, json=data)
print(response.json())
  1. Run the script and verify the payment response.
